results.title: Just Out of Reach
results.brief_description: A portrayal of a young woman’s conflict with an unresponsive world. Cath is rushed to hospital after a suicide attempt and the film traces back to her adolescence to reveal what has led to a despair so severe that suicide appears to be her only option. Her conflicts with her family, principally with her father, are later identified in her relationship with her husband. Each leads her to attempt suicide. Both attempts are the result of her utter despair at the loss of the love of the person who matters the most to her.

results.title: Just out of reach
results.creator_credit: Portrait Films, Ross Matthews and Linda Blagg
results.brief_description: A contemporary drama featuring Lorna Lesley, Sam Neill and Martin Vaughan. Portrays a young woman’s conflicts with her parents, her love affair while still at school, her marriage to her former teacher, their subsequent separation and the near disastrous effects it has upon her life. In tracing an archetypal journey from adolescence to adulthood, the film probes both the ‘silences of family life’ and the tenuousness of relationships. Suitable for senior students. Teacher preview recommended.

results.title: Just one of the boys
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ted Haley and Mike Mahoney
results.brief_description: A profile of Eric Davidson, who has been totally blind since the age of two, a victim of the 1917 Halifax explosion. Despite his blindness, Mr. Davidson has spent the past twenty years as a full-time automotive mechanic for the city of Halifax. He is actively involved in the restoration and rebuilding of antique cars and is a well known member of the Antique Car Club.

results.title: Just one kid
results.brief_description: An autobiographical look at the life of a Jewish boy growing up in London during the 1930’s providing a nostalgic impression of the Jewish community in London’s East End at that time. Highlights cultural traditions, continuity and change and the social conditions in the 30’s.

results.title: Just like you
results.creator_credit: Ideas That Work, Fran Haarsma Productions and Fran Haarsma
results.brief_description: Just like you is a comprehensive guide for people who are unsure of how to act around people with disabilities. The program answers questions such as, can you say “look” to a person who is blind? Do you offer to push someone in a wheelchair? Presented by people with disabilities, we are shown the preferred etiquette that can make interaction easier for both parties.

results.title: Just like you
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions and Eugene Osborne Smith
results.brief_description: Society is made up of all sorts of people who share common hopes and dreams. Each person should be able to advance according to ability. However, the difference between people create conflicts and barriers that hinder the success of some. A montage of photographs accompanied by the poem ‘Just Like You’ presents these concepts.

results.title: Just like machines
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Instructs on safe methods of handling pesticides, their application and storage. Stresses that the Department of Agriculture should be contacted for advice as to which pesticide to use for which pest, when there is doubt as to identity. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
